data.name: IntroPage_1_desc
data.value: We are here to assist you with your pension

data.name: IntroPage_2_desc
data.value: In this app you can learn everything about the scheme, apply for a pension, or simulate your expected pension

data.name: IntroPage_3_desc
data.value: You will also be able to read news and messages from us, or contact our servicedesk

data.name: IntroPage_4_desc
data.value: We are here to help you with all your questions. Happy customers and members is our goal!

data.name: IntroPage_5_desc
data.value: We have made a short film to explain how the app works

data.name: Calculator_desc
data.value: Here you can perform a simplified simulation of your pension. If you wish to have a more accurate estimation of your pension rights you can do that in our members portal.

data.name: Calculator_field2
data.value: Number of months of seagoing service in group 1

data.name: Calculator_field3
data.value: Number of months of seagoing service in group 2 before 30.04.93

data.name: Calculator_field4
data.value: Number of months of seagoing service in group 2 after 01.05.93

data.value: Number of dependent children under the age of 18

data.name: CalcResult_field1
data.value: Pension with means-tested supplementary payment of {0}%

data.name: Rules_desc
data.value:
﻿If you have worked on Norwegian vessels or mobile rigs, you may be entitled to an early retirement pension for seamen when you are aged between 60 and 67.
To qualify for a pension, you must have accrued a minimum of 150 months of seagoing service. Seagoing service on vessels in other EEA countries, fishing vessels and state-owned vessels also count towards your seagoing service. You may be entitled to a pension from your 60th birthday if you have accrued a minimum of 120 months of seagoing service after the age of 40 and are no longer working at sea. If you do not meet the requirement for 150 months of seagoing service, you may be entitled to a refund of your pension contributions. This is a one-off payment.

data.name: Rules_desc1
data.value:
Both you and your employer pay pension premiums/contributions. Both parts constitute contributions to your pension. The size of your pension premium/contribution depends on the position/salary level you have and on how many days you work a month. Contribution rates change every year as a result of adjustment of the National Insurance scheme basic amount.
Your employer pays a contribution which is equivalent to 3.3% of your gross monthly income. Your employer is responsible for deducting your pension contribution from your salary and pay in the pension contribution.

data.name: Rules_desc2
data.value:
To qualify for a seaman’s pension, you must usually have a minimum of 150 months of seagoing service. If you have accrued between 12 and 149 months of seagoing service, you may be able to add certain types of external seagoing service to reach the minimum requirement:
• Seagoing service from the Norwegian Guarantee Fund for Fishermen • Service under another public service pension scheme (e.g. the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund) applicable to accrual of service on maritime vessels • National service completed before 1981 if your service commenced within six months of the expiry of pensionable service or maritime training • Service on other EU/EEA-country vessels according to the provisions of the Agreement on the European Economic Area
Your external seagoing service is not included in the basis for calculation of the size of your pension.

data.name: Rules_desc3
data.value: Your annual pension payment is calculated by multiplying the number of months of your seagoing service with the pension rates applicable on the date that payment of your pension commences. Different pension rates apply for service accrued as primary or secondary service. Your pension will be calculated on the basis of a maximum of 360 months of seagoing service.

data.name: Help_calltimes_winter
data.value: The main switchboard is open from 8:00 am to 3.45 pm

data.name: Help_calltimes_summer
data.value: The main switchboard is open from 8:00 am to 3.00 pm

data.name: Settings_about_desc
data.value: Ditt PTS is developed by Megapop AS for Pensjonstrygden for sjømenn

data.name: About_desc1
data.value: Pension Insurance for Seamen (PTS) is a statutory pension scheme for employees working at sea. Our main task is to pay pensions to seafarers when they are aged between 60 and 67 and to receive contributions to premiums from both employees and employers.

data.name: About_desc2
data.value: The scheme is managed by PTS which is a public body under the Norwegian Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs. PTS is managed by a board of five members of which four are appointed by employee and employer organisations while the Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs appoints its chairman. We have 25 employees across five departments who all report directly to the director.

data.name: Push_notification_desc
data.value: For an improved user experience, you can receive information about your seasgoing service and messages.

data.name: Push_notification_local_desc
data.value: To get a better user experience, you can activate notifications. You will then receive notifications when your months of seagoing service are updated, when you receive your pension slip, when we send you a message and when we post news.

data.name: Static_call_desc
data.value: Do you wish to call PTS on 22 35 89 00?
